vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/27ff1e6a-bb05-45e8-bcc9-4b42f5d4d381">WORKERS PARTICIPATION</keyword>         <topcClas>Political behaviour and attitudes - Politics</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The first national survey of Labour Party members to analyse: range and type of political activism by Labour Party members; social background characteristics of members; attitudes on issues and values of members; methods of recruitment into Labour Party; activism in pressure groups.</abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br> Variables<br> Demographic and attitudinal influences on activism; attitudinal similarities and differences between Labour Party members and voters; influence of membership and activism on the vote.<br> Measurement Scales:<br> Thermometer scales (0-100) for parties, leaders, Labour politicians, other individuals/organisations; Likert scales (1-5-agree/disagree) on statements concerning political issues: Activism scale based on political activities.<br> Some of the questions were replicated from the 1987 British Election Study (held at the Archive under SN:2568) and the 1989 British Social Attitudes Survey (held at the Archive under SN:2723).</abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd event="start" date="1989-12-01T00:00:00Z">December 1989</timePrd>         <timePrd event="end" date="1990-05-01T00:00:00Z">May 1990</timePrd>         <collDate event="start" date="1989-12-07T00:00:00Z">07 December 1989</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="1990-05-12T00:00:00Z">12 May 1990</collDate>         <nation>Great Britain</nation>         <geogUnit>No information recorded</geogUnit>
